alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hampshire and Franklin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 352 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buckland, or 11 miles west of Greenfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Amherst, Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Montague, Sunderland, Northfield, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving, Shutesbury, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Pelham and Charlemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western and central Massachusetts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire
